column1: these “tools” include, inter alia, a number of so-called “rules,” although these are not
rules in the strict sense, as indicated by Lord Reid, in Maunsell v. Olins 8

column2: …….rules of construction…. are not rules in the ordinary sense of having some
force.  They  are  our  servants  not  our  masters.  They  are  aids  to

infrequently,  one  “rule”  points 
in  one  direction,  and
another  in  a  different  direction.  In  each  case  they  must  look  at  all  relevant
circumstances and decide as a matter of judgment what weight to attach to any
